alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 2:23PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wallace County through 145 PM MDT... At 121 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Sharon Springs, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Wallace County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
